# Preface {.unnumbered}

This book contains the materials for the course
*Network Analysis in Systems Biology with R/Bioconductor*, which I offer
in partnership with [Physalia courses](https://www.physalia-courses.org/).
This is a 4-day course, and each chapter of this book contains the materials
for one day. In details:

1. Inference and analysis of gene coexpression networks (GCNs)
2. Network comparison
3. Network-based data integration for gene discovery
4. Inference and analysis of gene regulatory networks (GRNs)

## Setup

To run the code in this book, you will need to install:

1.  R (\>=4.2.0): go to the [CRAN website](https://cran.r-project.org/), choose your OS (Windows, Linux, or macOS), and follow the installation instructions.

2.  RStudio Desktop: go to the [RStudio website](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/) and download the installer for your OS.

After installing R and RStudio, you will need to install some required 
R packages. To do that, open RStudio and execute the code below in your console:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Install BiocManager
install.packages("BiocManager")

# Use BiocManager to install required packages
packages <- c(
    "treeio", 
    "ggtree", 
    "ggtree", 
    "ape", 
    "here", 
    "Biostrings",
    "MSA2dist", 
    "msa", 
    "phangorn", 
    "seqinr",
    "doubletrouble",
    "feature"
)

BiocManager::install(packages)
```
:::


After that, you should have everything ready.
